feed.subtitle: Scramble is completely accurate weather-predicting duck in Eastford, Connecticut.

entry.title: Scramble Featured on WILI Radio
entry.content:
Today, Scramble the Duck was featured on the WILI 1400AM and 95.3FM Morning Show, interviewed by Wayne Norman.

You can listen to the interview here.

entry.title: Scramble to be on WILI AM
entry.content:
Scramble and his handlers will be featured on WILI AM Radio on January 28, 7:40-8 a.m., hosted by Wayne Norman. Scramble and his handlers will discuss how he predicts, what Duck Day will be like, and more. This is a great opportunity to learn about Scramble in his own words on the drive to work.

You can listen to last year's episode here.

entry.title: COVID-19 Updates
entry.content:
COVID-19 updates:

ðŸ‘‰ Watch Duck Day 2021 here.

Duck Day will be held virtually this year with no in-person gathering. Watch live on YouTube.

We will continue to update this post as we gather more information on what Duck Day will look like. Find news on Scramble's Facebook Page and subscribe to Scramble's YouTube channel for updates.

Resource: State and Federal guidelines.

entry.title: Hunt For Eggs with Scramble
entry.content:
Scramble understands that many people this year were not able to go on Easter Egg Hunts. Instead, you can go on a virtual Easter Egg Hunt with Scramble! Download the coloring page and find all the Easter Eggs. Have a blessed and happy Easter!

Click here to download a fun Easter Egg Hunt coloring page with Scramble!

entry.title: Scramble Proved Correct Again
entry.content:
Scramble has been proved correct yet again. Scramble the duck predicted six more weeks of winter on February 2, 2020. At first it was warm, but people realized Scramble was right. As the truth became clear, some rushed to the store to stock up on essentials, preparing to stay at home as if for a long blizzard. Scramble, once again, has proven his 100% accuracy.

In a statement to his team, Scramble said,

I would never have imagined that my prediction was so significant. This is not just a blizzard of frozen water, but rather a blizzard of disease and human fear. I foresaw that something of great importance was about to happen, something would cause people to hunker down; and I have been actively involved with finding solutions. My colleagues have been collaborating with authorities to help in this fight. Right now, we encourage everybody to take public health authorities' advice seriously and help end this winter-like condition.
